## ğŸ¤ Ways to Contribute

### 1. ğŸ› Report Bugs

Found a bug? Help us fix it!

- Check [existing issues](https://github.com/tailormyjob/issues) first
- Use the [bug report template](.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/bug_report.md)
- Include detailed steps to reproduce
- Add screenshots if helpful

### 2. ğŸ’¡ Suggest Features

Have an idea for improvement?

- Check [existing feature requests](https://github.com/tailormyjob/issues?q=label%3Aenhancement)
- Use the [feature request template](.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/feature_request.md)
- Explain the use case and benefits
- Vote on existing requests with ğŸ‘

### 3. ğŸ“– Improve Documentation

Help make our docs better!

- Fix typos and grammar
- Improve clarity and examples
- Add missing information
- Translate content (coming soon)
- Update outdated information

### 4. ğŸ“ Share Use Cases

Share your success story!

- Write about how TailorMyJob helped you
- Create tutorials or guides
- Share tips and best practices
- Help other users in discussions

### 5. ğŸ’¬ Help Others

Be part of the community!

- Answer questions in [Discussions](https://github.com/tailormyjob/discussions)
- Share your expertise
- Provide feedback on others' questions

## ğŸš€ Getting Started

### For Documentation Improvements

1. **Fork the repository**
   ```bash
   git clone https://github.com/tailormyjob/tailormyjob.git
   cd tailormyjob
   ```

2. **Create a branch**
   ```bash
   git checkout -b docs/improve-readme
   ```

3. **Make your changes**
   - Edit markdown files
   - Add examples or screenshots
   - Update related docs

4. **Test your changes**
   - Preview markdown rendering
   - Check all links work
   - Verify formatting

5. **Commit your changes**
   ```bash
   git add .
   git commit -m "docs: improve README clarity"
   ```

6. **Push and create PR**
   ```bash
   git push origin docs/improve-readme
   ```
   Then create a Pull Request on GitHub

## ğŸ“ Contribution Guidelines

### Pull Request Process

1. **Search First**: Check if a similar PR exists
2. **One Change Per PR**: Keep PRs focused on a single improvement
3. **Descriptive Title**: Use clear, descriptive PR titles
4. **Fill Template**: Complete the PR template thoroughly
5. **Link Issues**: Reference related issues
6. **Be Patient**: Wait for review and respond to feedback

### Commit Message Format

Use conventional commits:

```
type(scope): subject

body (optional)

footer (optional)
```

**Types:**
- `docs`: Documentation changes
- `fix`: Bug fixes in docs or examples
- `feat`: New documentation or examples
- `style`: Formatting changes
- `refactor`: Restructuring documentation

**Examples:**
```
docs: update API authentication section
docs(api): add webhook examples
fix: correct broken links in FAQ
feat: add career coach use case guide
```

### Review Process

1. **Automated Checks**: PRs must pass link validation
2. **Maintainer Review**: A maintainer will review your PR
3. **Feedback**: Address any requested changes
4. **Merge**: Once approved, we'll merge your PR
5. **Recognition**: Contributors are added to our credits!

## ğŸ“ Documentation Style Guide

### Writing Style

- **Clear and Concise**: Use simple language
- **Active Voice**: "Upload your resume" not "Resume should be uploaded"
- **Present Tense**: "The system analyzes..." not "The system will analyze..."
- **Second Person**: Address users as "you"
- **Inclusive Language**: Use gender-neutral language

### Formatting

**Headers:**
```markdown
# H1 - Page Title (one per page)
## H2 - Major Sections
### H3 - Subsections
#### H4 - Minor Points
```

**Lists:**
- Use `-` for unordered lists
- Use `1.` for ordered lists
- Keep items parallel in structure

**Code:**
- Use ` for inline code
- Use ``` for code blocks
- Specify language for syntax highlighting

**Links:**
- Use descriptive link text
- Check all links work
- Use relative links for internal docs

**Images:**
- Add alt text for accessibility
- Keep file size reasonable
- Use descriptive filenames

### Examples

**Good:**
```markdown
## Upload Your Resume

To upload your resume:

1. Click the "Upload" button
2. Select your file (PDF, DOC, or DOCX)
3. Wait for validation to complete

The system supports files up to 10 MB.
```

**Avoid:**
```markdown
## Resume Upload

You can upload resume by clicking upload and then select file.
PDF DOC DOCX supported, 10MB max.
```

### File Organization

```
docs/
â”œâ”€â”€ README.md           # Overview and navigation
â”œâ”€â”€ api/               # API documentation
â”œâ”€â”€ features/          # Feature guides
â”œâ”€â”€ use-cases/         # User scenarios
â”œâ”€â”€ FAQ.md            # Frequently asked questions
â””â”€â”€ PRICING.md        # Pricing information
```

## ğŸ“„ Code of Conduct

### Our Pledge

We are committed to providing a welcoming and inclusive environment for all contributors.

### Our Standards

**Positive Behavior:**
- Be respectful and inclusive
- Welcome newcomers
- Give and receive constructive feedback
- Focus on what's best for the community

**Unacceptable Behavior:**
- Harassment or discrimination
- Trolling or insulting comments
- Publishing others' private information
- Any conduct that would be inappropriate in a professional setting

### Enforcement

Instances of unacceptable behavior may be reported to opensource@tailormyjob.com. All complaints will be reviewed and investigated promptly and fairly.
